author: ralexstokes
content: so if the exit queue is empty, then it would be 5 epochs min, not 4 like you said (if this seems off i can go review at some point)

author: ralexstokes
content: and then yes, you are placed somewhere to exit the exit queue and 256 epochs after  *that*, are you "withdrawable"

author: ralexstokes
content: once you are withdrawable, then the chain processes your validator at the next epoch boundary where you go into a withdrawal queue

author: ralexstokes
content: this withdrawal queue is unloaded into the EVM at some rate per execution layer block, which is around 16 right now -- the constants could be fine tuned ahead of shipping the feature

author: potuz
content: This last is assuming you have an ETH1 withrawal credentials. Otherwise you'll be withrawable forever until you send an address change message. This message can be sent at any stage in the above diagram, active or not, slashed or not
